Make a tiny block-structured synthetic volume

make_block_synthetic.Rd

A scikit-learn style "make\_blobs" for neuroimaging demos. Builds a small 2D/3D mask with three spatial bands (left/mid/right) and clearly separated time-series patterns plus mild Gaussian noise. Designed to be fast, deterministic, and visually intuitive in vignettes and tests.

Usage

make_block_synthetic(dims = c(12, 12, 1), ntime = 80, noise = 0.15, seed = NULL)

Arguments

dims

Integer vector length 3, spatial dimensions. Default c(12,12,1).

ntime

Number of time points. Default 80.

noise

Standard deviation of added Gaussian noise. Default 0.15.

seed

Optional integer seed for reproducibility.

Value

List with elements vec (NeuroVec), mask (NeuroVol), and integer truth labels.

Examples

syn <- make_block_synthetic(dims = c(12, 12, 1), ntime = 60, noise = 0.1, seed = 7)
length(unique(syn$truth))
#> [1] 3
